intro: Dorstenia cayapia var. bryoniifolia, commonly known as the Cayapia spider plant, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Ecuador and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the tendrils of a spider. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy, spiny fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and sought-after species among botanists and plant enthusiasts.
